title.narrative: SOS Børnebyerne - Christmans Calender 2016: Let me Play and Learn - Improving Children's Lives in Dar es Salaam, Tanzania

description.narrative: The development objective is to improve the opportunities for children's play and learning through improved access to child-centred quality education and active participation in decision-making forums and governance of the development of the physical infrastructure of their schools and urban planning in the Chanika ward at the ourskirts of Ilala District near Dar es Salaam. The immediate objectives are: 1) Seven public schools have increased enrolment by 1,000 children by the end of the project in 2019, 2) Child-centred quality education is provided in the seven target schools, 3) Children's opportunity for playful and safe leisure time is improved, and 4) Children actively participate in decision-making forums and governance of development of the physical infrastructure of their schools.

The grant supports the SOS Børnebyerne project: Let me learn and play
The aim of the Let Me Play and Learn project was to improve the opportunities for the children’s play and learning at Chanika and Zingizwa ward in Ilala Muncipal Dar es Salaam. The project was originally a three-year project, which was extended for a year and was implemented between 2017 and 2020. The main focus was to improve the learning environment and strengthen the quality of education in the project area. Furthermore, the project supported out-of-school children to re-enter school by developing the capacity of a Government-led accelerated learning programme also known as the MEMKWA and provide pre-school children a stimulating and playful environment in nursery school and let children age 4-6 benefit from a caring and stimulating environment in a model community day care centre. The project and the activities were in line with the Sustainable Development Goals (SDG 4 on quality education) and Tanzania vision 2025, which both focus on addressing inequality, provision of quality education, health care, and child protection.
